item.title: June add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: June add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: June add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: June add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "Writing books is the closest men ever come to childbearing." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: June add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: June add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "I am certain there is too much certainty in the world." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: June add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: June add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "The past is always tense, the future perfect." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: June add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there." -- Will Rogers

item.title: June add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: June add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: June add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love – and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren

item.title: June add a quote by Nadine Gordimer
item.description: "The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is." -- Nadine Gordimer

item.title: June add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: June add a quote by Leonard Woolf
item.description: "Anyone can be a barbarian; it requires a terrible effort to remain a civilized man." -- Leonard Woolf

item.title: June add a quote by George Saunders
item.description: "Do those things that incline you toward the big questions, and avoid the things that would reduce you and make you trivial." -- George Saunders

item.title: June add a quote by Ashleigh Brilliant
item.description: "My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot." -- Ashleigh Brilliant

item.title: June add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where words leave off, music begins." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: June add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Tell me a story of deep delight." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: June add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "Eventually, all things merge into one, and a river runs through it." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: June add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: June add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They’re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: June add a quote by Vaclav Havel
item.description: "The salvation of this human world lies nowhere else than in the human heart, in the human power to reflect, in human meekness and human responsibility." -- Vaclav Havel

item.title: June add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: June add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: June add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: June add a quote by Haruki Marukami
item.description: "Whatever it is you're seeking won't come in the form you're expecting." -- Haruki Marukami

item.title: June add a quote by Anne Brontë
item.description: "It is better to arm and strengthen your hero, than to disarm and enfeeble your foe." -- Anne Brontë

item.title: June add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "The music in his laughter had a way of rounding off the missing notes in her soul." -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: June add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to." -- W.C. Fields
